SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Multiple neoplasms in a patient occur rarely
There has only been one case report about synchronous endometrial carcinoma and follicular lymphoma of the paraaortic and pelvic lymph node (LN) until now
CASE REPORT: The patient was 64 years old and had vaginal spotting for four months
She was diagnosed with endometrioid endometrial carcinoma by endometrial biopsy
In intraoperative inspection, the whole paraaortic and pelvic LN had formed into a massive tumor bundle following the aorta and iliac vessels
The diagnosis was endometrial carcinoma FIGO Stage IB with synchronous follicular lymphoma Stage III
We performed adjuvant chemotherapy and radiotherapy
Currently, the patient has no evidence of recurrence for either carcinoma
CONCLUSION: Lymph node dissection was included in the staging and debulking operation of the endometrial carcinoma
An inaccurate result of the frozen section can not rule out metastasis of endometrial carcinoma and surgeons can fall into a dilemma regarding treatment
